title: Course on Improving Mathematical Thinking Through Internet-Based Metacognitive Science Concept Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics comprehension and internet literacy
context.additional_context: Real-time collaborative discussions and personalized learning record management systems tailored for manager/leader roles

learning_goals: Students can explain complex mathematical concepts (e.g., function relationships, statistical inference) with 80% accuracy using metacognitive strategies.
Students can establish self-directed learning plans in online environments and revise/improve them three or more times.
Students can compare and evaluate two or more problem-solving strategies through peer feedback and metacognitive reflection.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
